segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Katherine, and today we're talking about one of our favorite topics here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们要谈论我们在EnglishPod最喜欢的话题之一。

segments.en: That would be food.
We love talking about food, and this time we are going to pick up some food at the deli.
segments.cn: 我们喜欢谈论食物，这次我们要去熟食店买一些食物。

segments.en: What's a deli?
A deli is a special store where a person can buy meats.
segments.cn: 熟食店是一个可以购买肉类的特殊商店。

segments.en: Meat and cheese.
And in this case, we're talking about special meats.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们谈论的是特殊的肉类。

segments.en: It's not just like pork or beef, which you could also buy at the butcher.
segments.cn: 这不仅仅是猪肉或牛肉，你也可以在肉店买到。

segments.en: It is cured meats, cold meats.
So let's take a look at today's vocabulary preview to find out more about this special kind of meat.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看今天的词汇预览，了解更多关于这种特殊肉类的信息。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
All right, so at the deli, you usually pick up cold cuts.
segments.cn: 好的，在熟食店，你通常会买到冷切肉。

segments.en: Cold cuts.
So basically, the way that I used to remember cold cuts as a child was that cold cuts are what you put on a sandwich.
segments.cn: 基本上，我小时候记住冷切肉的方式是，冷切肉是你放在三明治上的东西。

segments.en: So sliced Turkey, sliced chicken, ham, salami.
segments.cn: 比如切片火鸡、切片鸡肉、火腿、意大利香肠。

segments.en: OK, like pepperoni would be a cold cut, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，像意大利辣香肠就是冷切肉，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So cold cuts are meats that you serve cold normally.
segments.cn: 所以冷切肉是通常冷食的肉。

segments.en: They're usually cured.
They're not like raw pork or raw beef.
segments.cn: 它们不像生猪肉或生牛肉。

segments.en: You put them on a sandwich.
segments.cn: 你把它们放在三明治上。

segments.en: So cured meats would be like that they're smoked.
segments.cn: 所以腌制肉就像是它们被熏制。

segments.en: They're not cooked.
No, they're not cooked.
You're right.
They're smoked or they're cured with a kind of chemical or brine.
segments.cn: 它们被熏制或用某种化学物质或盐水腌制。

segments.en: That means that they're preserved.
segments.cn: 这意味着它们被保存了。

segments.en: They can last for a long time.
segments.cn: 它们可以保存很长时间。

segments.en: All right.
Very good.
So that's what we're getting at the deli.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们在熟食店要买的。

segments.en: Usually at the deli, you can pick up meats, cheeses and pickles and all that.
segments.cn: 通常在熟食店，你可以买到肉、奶酪、腌菜等等。

segments.en: All that good stuff.
All right.
So why don't we jump into our dialogue and listen to it for the first time?
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不跳入对话，第一次听听呢？

segments.en: Honey, we're all out of wine and cheese.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我们的酒和奶酪都没了。

segments.en: Do you mind running to the deli and picking up a few things?
segments.cn: 你介意去熟食店买一些东西吗？

segments.en: Can't wait.
I'm watching the game right now.
Your friends and family are coming over tonight and we still need to get a lot of things.
segments.cn: 你的朋友和家人今晚要来，我们还需要买很多东西。

segments.en: Fine.
What do you need?
Okay.
Pick up some cured meats to go with the wine.
Maybe a pound of Polish sausages, ham, liverwurst, salami and any other cold cuts that are on sale.
segments.cn: 也许一磅波兰香肠、火腿、肝香肠、意大利香肠和任何正在促销的冷切肉。

segments.en: I think I saw a promotion for pastrami.
segments.cn: 我想我看到过腌牛肉的促销。

segments.en: Also, get some coleslaw and a jar of olives.
segments.cn: 另外，买一些卷心菜沙拉和一罐橄榄。

segments.en: Whoa, wait a minute.
Isn't that a bit too much?
I mean, how much is all this going to cost?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，这一切要花多少钱？

segments.en: Never mind that.
Get some dips as well.
Get a jar of spinach and blue cheese dips and also some satsiki.
segments.cn: 买一罐菠菜和蓝奶酪蘸酱，还有一些酸奶黄瓜酱。

segments.en: If they have bean dip, get that as well.
segments.cn: 如果他们有豆类蘸酱，也买那个。

segments.en: Last but not least, get some pickles.
segments.cn: 最后但同样重要的是，买一些腌菜。

segments.en: Is that all, your majesty?
Very funny.
Get a move on.
People will be here any minute.
All right, we're back.
So now we're going to go into language takeaway, where we're going to take a look at six key words.
segments.cn: 现在我们要进入语言要点，我们将看看六个关键词。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
All right, so the first key word that we have, we actually talked about it already, but just to make sure that you got it, those are cured meats.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个关键词我们已经谈过了，但为了确保你明白，那就是腌制肉。

segments.en: Cured meats.
Well, to cure something is to preserve it in this case.
segments.cn: 嗯，腌制某物在这里是指保存它。

segments.en: So be careful because to cure has a couple of different meanings.
segments.cn: 所以要小心，因为腌制有几种不同的含义。

segments.en: But when we're talking about food, something that is cured is preserved.
segments.cn: 但当我们谈论食物时，腌制的东西是被保存的。

segments.en: For example, pickles are cured in salty water, brine.
segments.cn: 例如，腌菜是在盐水中腌制的。

segments.en: Oh, is that what it's called?
Brine?
Salty water.
Yeah.
No wonder I don't like pickles.
But pickles are like, if you don't put them in brine, they don't taste all soury and nasty.
segments.cn: 但腌菜就像，如果你不把它们放在盐水中，它们就不会尝起来酸酸的和恶心。

segments.en: No, that's because they're cucumbers.
segments.cn: 不，那是因为它们是黄瓜。

segments.en: So a cucumber becomes a pickle after it's been cured.
segments.cn: 所以黄瓜在腌制后变成腌菜。

segments.en: So we could talk about pork, but when pork is cured, it becomes ham.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以谈论猪肉，但当猪肉被腌制时，它就变成了火腿。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay.
So cured meats are meats that have been preserved through some kind of process, like using salt or drying them.
segments.cn: 所以腌制肉是通过某种过程保存的肉，比如用盐或干燥。

segments.en: Okay.
Awesome.
And one of these cured meats, I think maybe is a liverwurst.
segments.cn: 其中一种腌制肉，我想可能是肝香肠。

segments.en: Okay.
Well, this is a German lesson now, not just an English lesson.
segments.cn: 嗯，这现在是德语课，不仅仅是英语课。

segments.en: In English, we have a lot of words that come from German.
segments.cn: 在英语中，我们有很多来自德语的词。

segments.en: And one of these words is wurst.
Okay.
And that means sausage, right?
That's right.
Sausage.
So bratwurst, liverwurst.
And in this case, liverwurst, I'm sure you can guess what part of the pig that comes from.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，肝香肠，我相信你可以猜到它来自猪的哪个部位。

segments.en: Liver?
Very good, Marco.
You get a star for the day.
segments.cn: 你今天得到了一个星星。

segments.en: Yeah.
No, liverwurst is a kind of sausage that's made up of this part of the animal.
segments.cn: 不，肝香肠是一种由这种动物的部位制成的香肠。

segments.en: Okay.
Actually, I've never... I don't know if I've had liverwurst.
segments.cn: 其实，我从来没有……我不知道我是否吃过肝肠。

segments.en: What does it look like?
Is it white?
Is it red?
Is it... I think it's like dark, light, purplish, whitish.
segments.cn: 是……我觉得它是深色、浅色、紫色和白色的。

segments.en: I don't know.
I've had bloodwurst.
That's good.
Yeah.
Blood sausage is delicious.
And well, apart from picking up meats and cheeses at the deli, you can also pick up coleslaw.
segments.cn: 除了在熟食店买肉和奶酪，你还可以买卷心菜沙拉。

segments.en: All right, coleslaw is an American classic.
segments.cn: 好吧，卷心菜沙拉是美国经典。

segments.en: I'm sure you can get this other places as well, though.
segments.cn: 我相信你在其他地方也能找到这个。

segments.en: It's basically a cold salad that's made up of cabbage and carrots and maybe onions.
segments.cn: 基本上，它是一种由卷心菜、胡萝卜和可能的洋葱制成的冷沙拉。

segments.en: But generally, the sauce is white.
segments.cn: 但一般来说，酱是白色的。

segments.en: It's like a mayonnaise and vinegar sauce.
segments.cn: 就像是一种蛋黄酱和醋的酱。

segments.en: So it's very stringy.
Lots of thin, long pieces and the sauce is white.
segments.cn: 有很多细长的片，酱是白色的。

segments.en: Okay.
Yeah, I think this is a very American thing.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这是一种非常美国的东西。

segments.en: I'm not really sure if I've seen coleslaw in many other places, but I personally don't like it.
segments.cn: 我不太确定我是否在其他地方见过卷心菜沙拉，但我个人不喜欢。

segments.en: Again, because of the whole vinegar thing.
segments.cn: 再说一次，因为醋的原因。

segments.en: I'm not a big fan of the bitter stuff.
Yeah, I love... We also call it slaw, sometimes with a side of slaw.
segments.cn: 是的，我喜欢……我们有时也叫它沙拉，配上一份沙拉。

segments.en: I love a hot dog with a side of coleslaw.
segments.cn: 我喜欢热狗配卷心菜沙拉。

segments.en: Oh, really?
My favorite meals.
Oh, wow.
Okay.
So coleslaw.
Moving on, we have an interesting sauce.
segments.cn: 接下来，我们有一种有趣的酱。

segments.en: It's Greek, I believe.
That is correct.
And I'm not going to try to pronounce it because I might mess it up, so I'm going to leave that one to you.
segments.cn: 我不打算尝试发音，因为我可能会搞错，所以我把这个留给你。

segments.en: Well, I don't speak Greek, but this is how we say it in America.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不会说希腊语，但这是我们在美国的说法。

segments.en: Tzatziki.
Tzatziki.
Okay, tzatziki is a food that comes from Greece, like you said.
segments.cn: 好的，酸奶酱是来自希腊的食物，就像你说的。

segments.en: In America, we have a lot of different foods.
segments.cn: 在美国，我们有很多不同的食物。

segments.en: In Europe, too.
Wherever.
People come from all over the place.
And in America, we've adopted a number of foods.
segments.cn: 在美国，我们采纳了许多食物。

segments.en: One of these foods is tzatziki.
segments.cn: 其中一种食物就是酸奶酱。

segments.en: It's a white yogurt dip.
segments.cn: 它是一种白色的酸奶蘸酱。

segments.en: So usually in tzatziki, there is some onion, some cucumber, some pepper, but it's a really good, thick, creamy yogurt dip that you use with bread or chips.
segments.cn: 所以通常在酸奶酱中，有一些洋葱、黄瓜、胡椒，但它是一种非常好、浓稠、奶油状的酸奶蘸酱，可以和面包或薯片一起使用。

segments.en: Okay.
And that's actually our next word.
segments.cn: 这实际上是我们下一个词。

segments.en: You mentioned it's a dip.
So you're using that as a noun, and that's our next word, dip.
segments.cn: 所以你把它当作名词使用，这就是我们的下一个词，蘸酱。

segments.en: Dip.
So basically, a dip is a kind of food that you eat with other foods.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，蘸酱是一种你和其他食物一起吃的食物。

segments.en: Okay.
So it's like a sauce.
Exactly.
It's a sauce for finger foods.
segments.cn: 它是用于手指食物的酱。

segments.en: So basically, a dip is a food you eat with other foods.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，蘸酱是你和其他食物一起吃的食物。

segments.en: So you can have chips and dip.
segments.cn: 所以你可以有薯片和蘸酱。

segments.en: That would be potato chips with dip.
And sometimes you have tomato dip or cheese dip.
segments.cn: 有时你会有番茄蘸酱或奶酪蘸酱。

segments.en: In this case, we have tzatziki, or blue cheese dip.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们有酸奶酱，或者蓝奶酪蘸酱。

segments.en: Blue cheese dip.
Okay.
But actually, it's also a verb, right?
segments.cn: 但实际上，它也是一个动词，对吗？

segments.en: To dip.
So when you take your potato chip and you dip it in the dip.
segments.cn: 所以当你拿起薯片并把它蘸入蘸酱时。

segments.en: You can say that.
Yes.
Dip it in the dip.
Okay.
So you dip your potato chip in the dip.
segments.cn: 所以你把薯片蘸入蘸酱。

segments.en: Yes.
Very good.
So those are all the words that we have for you today on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们为你准备的词就是这些。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一遍对话，然后稍后再回来进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Honey, we're all out of wine and cheese.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我们的酒和奶酪都没了。

segments.en: Do you mind running to the deli and picking up a few things?
segments.cn: 你介意去熟食店买一些东西吗？

segments.en: Can't wait.
I'm watching the game right now.
Your friends and family are coming over tonight, and we still need to get a lot of things.
segments.cn: 你的朋友和家人今晚要来，我们还需要买很多东西。

segments.en: Fine.
What do you need?
Okay.
Pick up some cured meats to go with the wine.
Maybe a pound of Polish sausages, ham, liverwurst, salami, and any other cold cuts that are on sale.
segments.cn: 也许一磅波兰香肠、火腿、肝肠、意大利香肠，以及任何正在促销的冷切肉。

segments.en: I think I saw a promotion for pastrami.
segments.cn: 我想我看到过关于熏牛肉的促销。

segments.en: Also, get some coleslaw and a jar of olives.
segments.cn: 另外，买一些卷心菜沙拉和一罐橄榄。

segments.en: Whoa.
Wait a minute.
Isn't that a bit too much?
I mean, how much is all this going to cost?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，这一切要花多少钱？

segments.en: Never mind that.
Get some dips as well.
Get a jar of spinach and blue cheese dips and also some satsiki.
segments.cn: 买一罐菠菜和蓝奶酪蘸酱，还有一些酸奶酱。

segments.en: If they have bean dip, get that as well.
segments.cn: 如果他们有豆类蘸酱，也买那个。

segments.en: Last but not least, get some pickles.
Is that all, your majesty?
Very funny.
Get a move on.
People will be here any minute.
All right, we're back.
And now let's take a look at three key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器上的三个关键短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, this first one is a very, very common phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个是一个非常常见的短语。

segments.en: We use this a lot in English when we're maybe running late or you need something very quickly.
segments.cn: 当我们可能迟到或需要某样东西时，我们经常用到这个。

segments.en: We say, hey, can you run to the store and get this?
segments.cn: 我们会说，嘿，你能跑去商店拿这个吗？

segments.en: Or do you mind running to the deli?
segments.cn: 或者你介意跑去熟食店吗？

segments.en: So the verb here is to run to.
segments.cn: 所以这里的动词是“跑去”。

segments.en: Run to.
Run to the deli.
Now, does this mean that you're actually going to walk very fast to the deli?
segments.cn: 这是否意味着你真的要快步走到熟食店？

segments.en: You're going to run?
No, this is not literal.
This is not, okay, I'm going to go to the deli and I'm going to get some food.
segments.cn: 这不是，好的，我要去熟食店，我要拿些食物。

segments.en: No, this is going quickly.
So I could say, Marco, I have no time.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，Marco，我没有时间。

segments.en: Can you run to the store and get me some milk, please?
segments.cn: 你能跑去商店给我拿些牛奶吗？

segments.en: Okay, so that means just go really quickly in your car, your motorcycle, any way you can.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着就是在你的车、摩托车上，尽快去。

segments.en: Or walking, yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 或者走路，是的，正是如此。

segments.en: Good.
So that's run to the store, run to the deli.
segments.cn: 所以就是跑去商店，跑去熟食店。

segments.en: In this case, we saw it in the sentence, do you mind running to the deli?
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们在句子中看到了，介意跑去熟食店吗？

segments.en: So do you mind going quickly?
So this is going quickly.
Do you mind running to the deli?
This is a thing that we can do.
segments.cn: 这是我们可以做的事情。

segments.en: Okay.
And so she was telling him what to get and he's like, whoa, this is going to be really expensive.
segments.cn: 所以她告诉他要拿什么，他说，哇，这会很贵。

segments.en: And she answered with this phrase, never mind that.
segments.cn: 她用这个短语回答，没关系。

segments.en: Never mind that.
Okay, this is a phrase that we use when we want to say, don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 好的，这是我们用来表示“别担心”的短语。

segments.en: That doesn't matter.
No problem.
It's not important.
So a never mind, you could say by itself, never mind, forget about it.
segments.cn: 所以“没关系”，你可以单独说，没关系，忘了它。

segments.en: But never mind that is like saying, this argument is over.
segments.cn: 但“没关系”就像是在说，这个争论结束了。

segments.en: It's not a problem.
Okay, so never mind that.
As I was saying, let's go to the store.
segments.cn: 正如我所说的，让我们去商店。

segments.en: Okay, good.
So it's not important.
It's not relevant.
Don't worry about it.
Okay, very good.
And the last phrase that we have for you is a very interesting phrase when the girl said, you know what, very funny, but get a move on.
segments.cn: 我们为你准备的最后一个短语是一个非常有趣的短语，当女孩说，你知道吗，真有趣，但快点。

segments.en: People will be here any minute.
Get a move on.
Get a move on.
So as we often say here at EnglishPod, this is a kind of phrase we have to look at as a chunk, as a unit, as one piece, right?
segments.cn: 所以正如我们在EnglishPod常说的，这是一种我们必须作为一个整体来看待的短语，作为一个单元，作为一个整体，对吧？

segments.en: You could say get, get me this, or I move, I moved my house, but get a move on means hurry up, hurry up, start leaving now, go, go to the store, be quick about it.
segments.cn: 你可以说“拿”，拿给我这个，或者“我搬家”，但“快点”意味着快点，快点，现在就出发，去商店，快点。

segments.en: So this is a command, get a move on.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个命令，快点。

segments.en: Okay, so take it as a phrase, just like you know the phrase, hurry up or go quickly.
segments.cn: 好的，所以把它当作一个短语，就像你知道的短语，快点或快走。

segments.en: Remember the phrase, get a move on as a way of saying, come on, quickly, go, go, go quickly.
segments.cn: 记住短语“快点”，作为一种说法，快点，快点，快点。

segments.en: That's right.
Or as I always say when I'm with friends and we're, you know, going slowly somewhere, I say, hey guys, let's get a move on.
segments.cn: 或者正如我总是说的，当我和朋友在一起，我们慢慢走的时候，我会说，嘿，伙计们，快点。

segments.en: Let's get a move on.
They're going to close.
Let's get going.
Let's go here.
Okay.
Very good.
So get a move on.
Let's get a move on.
And why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue for one last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去再听一遍对话呢？

segments.en: Honey, we're all out of wine and cheese.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我们的酒和奶酪都没了。

segments.en: Do you mind running to the deli and picking up a few things?
segments.cn: 你介意跑去熟食店拿几样东西吗？

segments.en: Can't wait.
I'm watching the game right now.
Your friends and family are coming over tonight and we still need to get a lot of things.
segments.cn: 你的朋友和家人今晚要来，我们还需要买很多东西。

segments.en: Fine.
What do you need?
Okay.
Pick up some cured meats to go with the wine.
Maybe a pound of Polish sausages, ham, liverwurst, salami, and any other cold cuts that are on sale.
segments.cn: 也许一磅波兰香肠、火腿、肝肠、意大利腊肠，以及任何正在促销的冷切。

segments.en: I think I saw a promotion for pastrami.
segments.cn: 我想我看到过关于腌牛肉的促销。

segments.en: Also get some coleslaw and a jar of olives.
segments.cn: 还要拿一些卷心菜沙拉和一罐橄榄。

segments.en: Whoa, wait a minute.
Isn't that a bit too much?
I mean, how much is all this going to cost?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，这一切要花多少钱？

segments.en: Nevermind that.
Get some dips as well.
Get a jar of spinach and blue cheese dips and also some satsiki.
segments.cn: 拿一罐菠菜和蓝奶酪蘸酱，还有一些酸奶酱。

segments.en: If they have bean dip, get that as well.
segments.cn: 如果他们有豆子蘸酱，也拿那个。

segments.en: Last but not least, get some pickles.
segments.cn: 最后但同样重要的是，拿一些腌黄瓜。

segments.en: Is that all, your majesty?
Very funny.
Get a move on.
People will be here any minute.
All right, we're back.
So now, Catherine, I understand you're a big fan of pickles and olives and all that stuff.
segments.cn: 所以现在，Catherine，我知道你是腌黄瓜和橄榄的超级粉丝。

segments.en: I love cured food.
Oh, really?
Pickled.
Have you ever had a pickled tomato?
I hate pickled tomatoes.
Pickled tomatoes, pickled pickles, pickled olives, everything.
segments.cn: 腌番茄、腌菜、腌橄榄，所有的。

segments.en: I love it all.
I hate... actually, there are a couple of things that I don't really like.
segments.cn: 我讨厌……其实有几样东西我不太喜欢。

segments.en: For example, coleslaw.
You mentioned that it has cabbage in it.
segments.cn: 你提到它里面有卷心菜。

segments.en: And many people may know this vegetable as this purple lettuce, right?
segments.cn: 很多人可能知道这种蔬菜是紫色生菜，对吧？

segments.en: It looks like a lettuce, but it's purple.
segments.cn: 它看起来像生菜，但它是紫色的。

segments.en: That's right.
I hate it.
I don't like it.
And I actually hate olives and pickles.
segments.cn: 而且我其实讨厌橄榄和腌菜。

segments.en: I can't really eat them.
Sounds like you don't like bitter things like vinegar, olives.
segments.cn: 听起来你不喜欢像醋、橄榄这样的苦味东西。

segments.en: Yeah, no, not a big fan.
Not a big fan of anything that's bitter.
Love it.
It's one of my favorite.
I love salty foods and I love bitter foods.
segments.cn: 我喜欢咸的食物，也喜欢苦的食物。

segments.en: And that's all I have to say about it.
I've never really understood how people have like a whole pickle and they take it out of the jar and they just bite into it.
segments.cn: 我从来不理解人们怎么能整个腌菜拿出来咬一口。

segments.en: It's like, that's nasty.
Well, the adjective to describe a pickle's flavor is sour.
segments.cn: 描述腌菜味道的形容词是酸。

segments.en: It's very sour.
And in America at delis, you can buy full sours or half sours.
segments.cn: 在美国的熟食店，你可以买全酸或半酸的腌菜。

segments.en: So some pickles are less sour than others.
segments.cn: 所以有些腌菜比其他的酸得少。

segments.en: We call it a half sour.
My favorite pickles are full sours.
segments.cn: 我最喜欢的腌菜是全酸的。

segments.en: Really?
Make you cry a little bit.
The whole pickle thing, is this very American?
segments.cn: 整个腌菜的事情，这很美国吗？

segments.en: Because you always have pickles in burgers, for example, right?
segments.cn: 因为你总是在汉堡里放腌菜，对吧？

segments.en: You go to McDonald's, you have pickles in burgers.
segments.cn: 你去麦当劳，汉堡里有腌菜。

segments.en: Is this very American or is this coming from another place?
segments.cn: 这很美国，还是来自其他地方？

segments.en: It comes from Europe.
A lot of German food involves pickles, pickled vegetables.
segments.cn: 很多德国食物都涉及腌菜、腌制蔬菜。

segments.en: The Koreans also, Korean food has a lot of pickled vegetables like kimchi, which is pickled cabbage.
segments.cn: 韩国人也是，韩国食物有很多腌制蔬菜，比如泡菜，就是腌制的卷心菜。

segments.en: And so in Chinese culture as well, a lot of pickled foods.
segments.cn: 所以在中国文化中也有很多腌制食品。

segments.en: So I think this is something that's very common all over the world.
segments.cn: 我认为这是全世界都很常见的东西。

segments.en: You can have pickled fish.
Really?
You can pickle anything.
I don't know if we pickle things in Latin America.
segments.cn: 我不知道我们在拉丁美洲是否腌东西。

segments.en: This is why it seems very strange to me.
segments.cn: 这就是为什么这对我来说很奇怪。

segments.en: But this is a really interesting topic.
segments.cn: 但这是一个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: Why don't you let us know what your favorite cured meats are?
segments.cn: 你为什么不告诉我们你最喜欢的腌制肉类是什么？

segments.en: I know there are a lot of different types.
segments.cn: 我知道有很多不同类型。

segments.en: And if you like pickles or not, maybe some people out there will support me and say they don't like pickles.
segments.cn: 如果你喜欢腌菜，或者不喜欢，可能有些人会支持我，说他们不喜欢腌菜。

segments.en: And if you have delis in your home country, let us know.
segments.cn: 如果你在你的祖国有熟食店，告诉我们。

segments.en: I've always been curious about this.
Do you have delis or do you just have a butcher shop?
segments.cn: 你有熟食店，还是只有肉店？

segments.en: What's the difference?
Awesome.
So we'll see everyone there.
EnglishPod.com.
Until next time.
Bye, everyone.
